vacancy.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a job that is available for someone to start doing
vacancy.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: There are still two vacancies on the school board.
The council is making every effort to fill the vacancies.
We have no vacancies for photographers at the moment.
vacancy.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a room in a hotel or building that is not being used and is available for someone to stay in
vacancy.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Let me see if we have a vacancy for tonight.
vacancy.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: His mouth fell open and the look of vacancy returned.
vacancy.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: He searched the newspapers regularly for job vacancies.
We will keep your CV on file in case other suitable vacancies arise.
The teaching unions estimate there are some 10,000 unfilled vacancies.
Other officers are working overtime because of staff vacancies.
We have no vacancies for cleaners at present.
Where did you see the vacancy advertised?
We are making every effort to fill the vacancies.
the vacancy which was created by White’s resignation
She asked if there were any vacancies for salespeople.
A vacancy has arisen on the committee.
vacancy.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a job that is available for someone to start doing
vacancy.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: We havejob vacancies for graduates in engineering and information technology.
A vacancy has arisen (=become available) in the department for a senior accountant.
We haven’t been able to find anyone to fill this vacancy.
vacancy.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a hotel room, flat, or office which has not been taken and which is therefore available for rent
vacancy.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Apartment vacancies are still high in several markets.
